channel.title: Help with running my server (pics included)
channel.description:
right ive foloed and done wat was told and explained in the guide for making my own server but still does not work. im using project16 v.3,the link for projest16 v.4.5 didnt work
heres what i edited the compile file too, like said in the guide [img]http://img78.imageshack.us/img78/986/problem1lp1.png[/img] and heres what comes up when i open the compile [img]http://img102.imageshack.us/img102/5264/problem2em6.png[/img] i took out the *.java and server bit because it said it had an error like so.. [img]http://img78.imageshack.us/img78/8153/problem3td1.png[/img] and i thought i solve my problem and this comes up with no error messages [img]http://img75.imageshack.us/img75/1795/problem4cp1.png[/img] when i try to runserver.bat its a really quick flash then dissapears, i managed to printscreen in time tho [img]http://img75.imageshack.us/img75/4226/problem5jb1.png[/img] and dont say i aint got the java cuz ive got tons..lol, mount of times ive downloaded these..( plz do if i aint got right one :P) [img]http://img75.imageshack.us/img75/8229/javaww3.png[/img]

umm it says it got a error ud ont take out the error u fix them or itll clouse like that a problem happend to me like that it was your system classpath that might be fucked

item.title: Help with running my server (pics included)
item.dc:creator: @pkedpker pkedpker
item.description:
@pkedpker wrote:

why do u use
“C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_09\bin\javac.exe”?

why not set your JAVA PATH in Environment Variables and just use

@echo off COLOR 08 title Compile javac.exe -cp . *.java pause

might fix problems searching the file

edit:
ok to set your java path you have to right click My Computer
go to Properties -> Advanced tab

in System variables groupbox go look in that Listbox for Path Variable and double click it

you will see something like

%SystemRoot%\system32;%SystemRoot%;%SystemRoot%\System32\Wbem;C:\Program Files\ATI Technologies\ATI Control Panel;C:\Program Files\Microsoft SQL Server\80\Tools\Binn\;C:\Program Files\Microsoft SQL Server\90\Tools\binn\;C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_09\bin;%XMLBEANS_HOME%\bin

simply add a ; in the end of that and type
C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_09\bin

Read full topic
item.source: Help with running my server (pics included)

item.title: Help with running my server (pics included)
item.dc:creator: @system system
item.description:
@system wrote:

maybe you can use this:
make a backup of your current file, because it wantn’t work on all pc’s

@echo off
COLOR 08
title Compile
"C:\Program Files\Java\jdk1.5.0_09\bin\javac.exe" -cp . *.java
pause

im using this, i still get a problem but i’m on my way
if you don’t understand me, im Dutch so…

Read full topic

item.title: Help with running my server (pics included)
item.dc:creator: @Laserous Laserous
item.description:
@Laserous wrote:

… um… well for one, after you moded your compiler, you should have ran it in the folder named “java” (if you have one, which since it has a class error that states that it can’t find bob.class I’d figure that you have one) It would have created a bunch of .class files which you stick in the Class folder… then… your server should run… maybe…

probably not…

Read full topic
